Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

From design through launch, the System Safety Office works closely with projects to ensure the protection of personnel, flight-critical hardware and facilities. As a System Safety Engineer, the selected candidate will work closely with JPL projects providing support that includes technical advice and direction, hazard analyses, risk mitigation techniques and hazardous operations support, ensuring compliance with JPL, NASA, Range and launch site requirements, safety practices, standards and regulations. JPL is undertaking many amazing missions to explore Mars, Jupiter and our own home planet, and we are seeking a candidate that has an extensive system safety engineering technical background to join our team and contribute to mission success!
 

Responsibilities:

  • Be responsible for the System Safety Program for one or more highly complex and critical projects

  • Provide customer-oriented system safety engineering expertise to JPL Projects to lead efficient and effective systems safety programs

  • Evaluate and assess hazards associated with hardware and software systems design and operations

  • Lead assigned project(s) in the implementation of appropriate mitigation techniques, safeguarding equipment, facilities, and the environment

  • Provide coordination with JPL institutional organizations, NASA centers, and external organizations on systems safety issues

  • Prepare safety compliance documentation for the Project

  • Be accountable for team results on all components of critical projects and assignments, including performance standards, budget and schedule

  • Serve as a JPL technical expert representative to NASA for multiple highly complex and unique projects, and serve on review boards

  • Conduct or oversee all types of mishap/close call investigations

  • Travel in support of projects, potentially including extended launch campaign or other project support
     

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor of Science (BS) degree in Aerospace Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, or related discipline with typically  a minimum of 9 years of relevant experience; or Masters degree in similar disciplines with a minimum of 7 years of relevant experience; or PhD in similar disciplines with a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience.

  • Wide-ranging experience and advanced knowledge in the field of System Safety Engineering

  • Demonstrated ability to lead team members in the development and operation of complex safety critical systems, and to work with customers to ensure successful implementation of systems safety programs.

  • Ability to prioritize schedules in support of multiple customers and identify potentially hazardous operations, conditions that could directly involve or potentially impact personnel or space flight hardware.

  • Extensive experience in hazard analyses and in-depth familiarity with safety requirements (AFSPCMAN 91-710 or NS 8719.24)

  • Experience performing independent risk assessment of products and processes 

  • Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work well in team environment as lead or team member.

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including presentation skills

Desired Skills:

  • Familiarity with safety requirements (AFSPCMAN 91-710 or NS 8719.24)

  • Knowledge of NASA policies and procedures

  • Systems Safety Engineering field/floor experience

  • Experience in dealing with all levels of personnel and management

  • Extensive experience in technical documentation

  • Ability to obtain TS/SCI clearance

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
